misconceptions.description: Student adds x + y instead of using √(x² + y²)
misconceptions.explanation: The magnitude is the LENGTH of the vector, which uses Pythagorean theorem
misconceptions.remediation: Think of a right triangle: the vector is the hypotenuse, x and y are the legs

misconceptions.description: Student multiplies elements and keeps as vector instead of summing
misconceptions.explanation: Dot product gives a SCALAR (single number), not a vector

misconceptions.description: Student multiplies element-by-element instead of row×column
misconceptions.explanation: Matrix multiplication uses dot products: row of A • column of B
misconceptions.remediation: Each result element comes from a row-column dot product

misconceptions.description: Student confuses which dimensions must match for multiplication
misconceptions.explanation: Inner dimensions must match: (m×n) × (n×p) → columns of first = rows of second
misconceptions.remediation: Think: 'inner dimensions cancel out' like fractions

misconceptions.description: Student adds diagonal elements instead of ad-bc
misconceptions.remediation: Main diagonal MINUS anti-diagonal, with multiplication

misconceptions.description: Student thinks det=0 means matrix is 'empty' or 'zero'
misconceptions.explanation: det=0 means the matrix squishes space to a lower dimension (no inverse exists)
misconceptions.remediation: Zero determinant = columns are linearly dependent = no inverse

misconceptions.description: Student takes 1/each element instead of proper inverse formula
misconceptions.explanation: Matrix inverse requires swapping, negating, and dividing by determinant
misconceptions.remediation: For 2×2: swap a↔d, negate b and c, divide all by det

misconceptions.description: Student tries to find inverse when det=0
misconceptions.explanation: If det=0, NO inverse exists. The matrix is 'singular'
misconceptions.remediation: Always check det first! det=0 → no inverse

misconceptions.description: Student thinks diagonal elements are always eigenvalues
misconceptions.remediation: Diagonal = eigenvalues ONLY for diagonal matrices

misconceptions.description: Student confuses trace (sum of diagonals) with eigenvalues
misconceptions.explanation: Trace = SUM of eigenvalues, but individual eigenvalues must be calculated
misconceptions.remediation: trace(A) = λ₁ + λ₂ + ... (a check, not the answer)
